description: Acute Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction (I21.4) KEY FEATURES: Acute chest pain, ST-segment changes, elevated cardiac troponins/enzymes, acute coronary event, NEW ischemic changes on EKG
Coronary Atherosclerosis (I25.10) KEY FEATURES: Chronic coronary artery disease, stable angina, history of CAD, coronary stenosis on angiography, chronic ischemic heart disease (NOT acute MI)

Nonrheumatic Aortic Valve Stenosis with Insufficiency (I35.2) KEY FEATURES: Aortic valve disease, systolic murmur, valve calcification, echocardiogram showing aortic stenosis/regurgitation, valve dysfunction
Unspecified Congestive Heart Failure (I50.9) KEY FEATURES: Reduced ejection fraction, pulmonary edema, fluid overload, acute decompensated heart failure, elevated BNP/NT-proBNP
